titles.title: Same Insurance as Congress Act of 1998
To amend title 5, United States Code, to make the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program available to the general public, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Government Reform and Oversight

bill.summary: 8/6/1998--Introduced. Same Insurance as Congress Act of 1998 - Requires any carrier of a plan approved under the Federal Employees Health Benefits Program to offer health insurance to individuals who are not eligible: (1) to be enrolled in a group health plan; or (2) for Medicare, Medicaid, or Children's Health Insurance Program benefits under the Social Security Act. Sets forth provisions concerning premiums, contributions, benefits, and the exclusion of a carrier or plan. Terminates the provisions of this Act ten years after enactment.
